# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> string(x[1], "mm")) do date
        split(string(date), "-")[1:2]
    end
    return df
end
```

This function uses the `map` function to apply a anonymous function to each element of the `dt` column. The anonymous function splits the string representation of the date using hyphens and takes the first two elements (year and month), then concatenates them together with "mm" to form the desired format. Finally, it converts the result back to an integer by calling `string()`.
